intro: Rhamphogyne papuana, commonly known as the Papuan rhamphogynum, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at elevations above 1,500 meters. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, Rhamphogyne papuana is considered a vulnerable species.
